attributes.title: Inventors Killed by their Own Inventions
attributes.caption: Geniuses tragically killed by their own creations.
attributes.description:
Necessity may be the mother of invention, but, on rare occasions, death is the result. Some of history’s brilliant minds and go-getters were tragically killed by their own creations, as recounted in this episode.

attributes.title: The Boston Molasses Flood
attributes.caption: Slip-sliding into Boston’s Great Molasses Flood of 1919.

attributes.caption: Ah, those pesky "wayward" women.
attributes.description:

attributes.title: What is a Lobotomy and How Were People Forced Into One?
